meanings.definition: To take away the virginity of (a woman)
meanings.sent1: The villain deflowers the princess in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The wicked sorcerer deflowers the innocent maiden against her will.
meanings.sent3: The evil witch deflowers the enchanted garden by casting a spell on it.
meanings.sent4: The storm deflowers the once lush meadow, leaving it barren and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The ruthless conqueror deflowers the peaceful village, destroying its harmony and purity.

meanings.definition: To deprive of beauty or freshness
meanings.sent1: The harsh winter deflowers the blooming flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting proper care can deflower the once vibrant garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel deflowers the neatly arranged flowerbed by digging up the plants.
meanings.sent4: The passing of time deflowers the youthful appearance of the old painting.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind deflowers the delicate petals of the rose, leaving it wilted and faded.
